snippet: The decision to call in an outside expert could help the Metropolitan Opera and its unions come to an agreement on the scope of the company’s financial troubles.
abstract: Metropolitan Opera, which had threatened to lock out its workers if it did not reach new deals with its labor unions, says it will extend its current contracts for about a week while independent analysts examines its finances; decision could help Met and unions come to agreement on scope of financial troubles.
lead_paragraph: The decision to call in an outside expert could help the Metropolitan Opera and its unions come to an agreement on the scope of the company’s financial troubles.

headline.main: Lockout Is Delayed While an Independent Analyst Examines the Met’s Finances
headline.print_headline: Lockout Is Delayed While an Independent Analyst Examines the Met’s Finances
